messages.content: ComfyUI-ppm is a collection of random nodes modified, fixed, or created by the author and others to extend the functionality of ComfyUI.
What is the purpose of the CLIPNegPip node in ComfyUI-ppm?
The CLIPNegPip node in ComfyUI-ppm allows users to use negative weights in prompts, increasing compatibility with other nodes.
What modifications were made to the AttentionCouplePPM node in ComfyUI-ppm?
The AttentionCouplePPM node in ComfyUI-ppm was made compatible with the CLIPNegPiP node and the default PatchModelAddDownscale (Kohya Deep Shrink) node.
What is the purpose of the CFG++SamplerSelect node in ComfyUI-ppm?
The CFG++SamplerSelect node in ComfyUI-ppm adapts samplers to the CFG++ method, which helps reduce the overexposure effect in generated images.
What is the purpose of the Guidance Limiter node in ComfyUI-ppm?
The Guidance Limiter node in ComfyUI-ppm implements the method of applying guidance in a limited interval to improve sample and distribution quality in diffusion models.
What does the Empty Latent Image (Aspect Ratio) node in ComfyUI-ppm do?
The Empty Latent Image (Aspect Ratio) node in ComfyUI-ppm generates an empty latent with a specified aspect ratio and respects the target resolution.
What is the purpose of the CLIPTextEncodeBREAK node in ComfyUI-ppm?
The CLIPTextEncodeBREAK node in ComfyUI-ppm is a lightweight wrapper that can split prompts by the BREAK keyword into chunks and produce a single concatenated conditioning.
What does the CLIPTokenCounter node in ComfyUI-ppm do?
The CLIPTokenCounter node in ComfyUI-ppm counts tokens in prompts and returns them as a string, with an option to print token count and individual tokens.
